Column Comment.0: UNIT OF MEASURE IDENTIFIER: A unique set of characters used to symbolize theunit concisely. Note these can use upper and lower case. For example, s (second),kg (kilogram). This value is a natural key value created to provide uniqueness. In thecase of the sample data, they may not reflect the usage of the referfence source.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: BASE UNIT: A Y/N flag indicating that this unit of measure in the measurment systemis recognized as a base unit of measure in the measurement system. For example,the meter is a base unit in the SI system. The Centimeter is a base unit inthe CGSsystem.
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.5: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.6: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.7: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.8: SOURCE DOCUMENT: the document from which this reference information wasobtained.
Column Comment.9: UNIT NAME: The full or complete name for the unit of measure. In the sample data,symbols and abveviations will not be used, but compound unit names will be. Theword per will be used to represent ratios (eg: metre per second, rather thanmeter/second). If multiple sources define this unit name, precedence order will definethe source to be used. The long name may not be unique unless qualified with unitsystem and unit type.
Column Comment.10: PPDM QUANTITY: Describes the type of value that is being measured, TheConventions of ASTM/IEEE SI-10 are used wherever possible. For example, length,luminance, mass density, power.
Column Comment.11: UNIT SYSTEM: Name of the measurement system. For example, SI.
Column Comment.12: PPDM UNIT OF MEASURE USAGE: A list of the valid types of usage values, usuallyas defined by an authorized agency such as IEEE. Usual values would be NULL orCURRENT for current, deprecated, discouraged or strongly discouraged. Note thatdifferent reference sources may supply different values for usage. For example, APIRP66 shows the BAR as a current unit of measure while the SI-10 shows it asdeprecated.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
